item.title: Domini add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "And I can't be running back and fourth forever between grief and high delight." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Domini add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I don't know what good it is to know so much and be smart as whips and all if it doesn't make you happy." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Domini add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "For I have known them all already, known them allâ€” Have known the evenings, mornings, afternoons, I have measured out my life with coffee spoons." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Domini add a quote by William Zinsser
item.description: "Write about small, self-contained incidents that are still vivid in your memory. If you remember them, it's because they contain a larger truth that your readers will recognize in their own lives. Think small and you'll wind up finding the big themes in your family saga. " -- William Zinsser
